body_html:
As mentioned above, if the cond scalar is forced on host memory, then there's little benefit to using this over tf.cond(), which is exactly the same thing.

I don't think this PR makes sense if the 'cond' input is host memory, it's just adding more complexity for no benefit.

body:
As mentioned above, if the cond scalar is forced on host memory, then there's little benefit to using this over tf.cond(), which is exactly the same thing.

I don't think this PR makes sense if the 'cond' input is host memory, it's just adding more complexity for no benefit.
